result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky A. Thorne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To be paid within 45 days.
DNA surcharge.
Defendant to report to St. Croix County Jail no later than May 15, 2017 to provide a DNA sample.

Order for payment on February 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Eric Gordon Johnson, DF ATTY: Mark J Gherty, DF: Ricky A. Thorne appeared by skype.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State amends Ct. 1 and adds a Ct. 3.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct. 1 (Endanger Safety with use of a Dangerous Weapon) 941.20(1)(a) and No Contest to Ct 2  and to the added Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct) 947.01. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1, Ct. 2 and the additional Ct. 3. Sentencing arguments.  Restitution has been paid.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

Amended Ct. 1 (Endanger Safety with use of a Dangerous Weapon) 941.20(1)(a) & Ct. 2 & added Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct) 947.01.
- Court orders a fine and court costs of $2,329.00
- 45 DTP
- DE to report to the St. Croix County Jail no later than 05/15/2017 to provide a DNA sample
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Mark J Gherty, DF: Ricky A. Thorne appeared.  Court called at 9:12 a.m. Set for preliminary hearing.  DE is waiving his right to a preliminary.  DE files with the court a Waiver of a Preliminary Examination. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 9:15 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing at 05-04-2016 09:00 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Lisa K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
